pr_title: Prevent inactive child clients from slowing down sendAndPoll

timeline.message:
CompositeNetworkClient: Prevent inactive child clients from slowing down sendAndPoll

Previously, CompositeNetworkClient.sendAndPoll iterates over each child
NetworkClient and calls sendAndPoll on each of them. This is alright if
both child clients are active and with many requests/responses to handle.
However, if one of the clients is less active, it may wait for up to the
configured poll timeout. Since this iteration is done from a single loop,
waiting for the inactive client prevents responses produced by the other
child client from being handled.

To fix this, this change introduces background threads so that each
sendAndPoll can run in parallel (similar to parallelism in Selector).
Whichever child client finishes its sendAndPoll first will call wakeup
on the other child clients to indicate that they should return from
sendAndPoll immediately.

Fixes #1492

timeline.bodyText: If we eat this exception, what will happen to the response consumers, will they just time out?
timeline.author: lightningrob

replies.bodyText:
Yep, they will just time out in the router after the configured routerRequestTimeout and a request will be sent to another replica.
This isn't the greatest, but i noticed that if we rethrow the exception (or encounter any other RuntimeException in sendAndPoll), the router will be closed: https://github.com/linkedin/ambry/blob/master/ambry-router/src/main/java/com/github/ambry/router/NonBlockingRouter.java#L1012
I think swallowing the error is better than doing this. However, one could also argue that such errors are truly unexpected and require the frontend to be restarted.
